meanings.definition: One of two identical things produced at the same time or by the same process.
meanings.sent1: I found a duplicate of my favorite toy in the toy store.
meanings.sent2: The printer accidentally made a duplicate of the document.
meanings.sent3: It was funny to see a duplicate of my friend's drawing, they must have the same artistic style.
meanings.sent4: The two trees in the garden looked like duplicates, as if they were twins.
meanings.sent5: The detective found a duplicate key at the crime scene, which helped solve the mystery.

meanings.definition: To make an identical copy of something.
meanings.sent1: I will duplicate this important document for safekeeping.
meanings.sent2: She used a photocopier to duplicate the recipe for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The magician tried to duplicate the coin trick but failed hilariously.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to duplicate complex dance moves amazed the audience.
meanings.sent5: The artist wanted to duplicate the painting, so she carefully studied the original.

meanings.definition: To be identical or nearly identical to something else.
meanings.sent1: The new dress design seems to duplicate the style of the famous designer.
meanings.sent2: The counterfeit watch was made to duplicate the expensive brand.
meanings.sent3: The twins often dress alike, unintentionally duplicating each other's outfits.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting was so neat that it almost duplicated a printed font.
meanings.sent5: The software was able to duplicate the image perfectly, making it hard to tell the difference.
